bundle.name: Design review
bundle.description: This method involves reviewing design concepts with stakeholders to get feedback and identify potential issues before development begins.

bundle.name: Low fidelity prototype
bundle.description: This involves creating a basic mock-up of a product or feature with simple materials like paper or wireframe, to test various aspects of the product design and work out key user interactions.

bundle.name: Low fidelity prototype

bundle.name: Remote usability testing
bundle.description: Conducting usability tests on a website or app with participants who are located remotely, usually via a video call or screen-sharing software.

bundle.name: User interview
bundle.description: A one-on-one discussion with the user to gather detailed information about their experiences, needs, and pain points related to a product or service.

bundle.name: Design review
bundle.description: This method involves reviewing design concepts with stakeholders to get feedback and identify potential issues before development begins.

bundle.name: Low fidelity prototype
bundle.description: This involves creating a basic mock-up of a product or feature with simple materials like paper or wireframe, to test various aspects of the product design and work out key user interactions.

bundle.name: Remote usability testing
bundle.description: Conducting usability tests on a website or app with participants who are located remotely, usually via a video call or screen-sharing software.

bundle.name: User interview
bundle.description: A one-on-one discussion with the user to gather detailed information about their experiences, needs, and pain points related to a product or service.

bundle.name: High fidelity prototype
bundle.description: Refers to an advanced prototype that closely mimics the final product , often created with interactive features and more detailed graphics to test specific functionality.

bundle.name: Analytics review
bundle.description: Refers to the analysis of data gathered from user interactions with a product or service to improve its performance or user experience.

bundle.name: User interview
bundle.description: A one-on-one discussion with the user to gather detailed information about their experiences, needs, and pain points related to a product or service.

bundle.name: Competitive analysis
bundle.description: Comparing your product or design with those of other industry players in order to identify competitive differentiation and gain insight as to what could be improved upon.

bundle.name: In-person usability testing
bundle.description: This method involves conducting user tests in person, often in a lab or other controlled environment. It's often used to gather detailed feedback about specific aspects of a design.

bundle.name: Analytics review
bundle.description: Refers to the analysis of data gathered from user interactions with a product or service to improve its performance or user experience.

bundle.name: Field study
bundle.description: This involves observing real-world scenarios in which users interact with a product or service to gain insights into user behaviors, pain points, and other factors that could influence UX design decisions.
